headlines: Bitcoin, AI stock slide sees over $500 million in bullish bets wiped out
Why bitcoin ETFs look like they're falling short, even as their role grows: Asia Morning Briefing
PayPal, issuer of PYUSD, applies for Utah industrial bank license
events: Bitcoin price drop to $86,000 due to AI stock sell-off and rate cut risk
PayPal applying for Utah industrial bank license to launch PYUSD stablecoin banking services
ETF adoption concerns despite growing interest in Bitcoin ETFs
articles.summary: Bitcoin dropped below $86,000 amid broader market sell-offs driven by AI stock declines and uncertainty around rate cuts. This triggered significant liquidations, with over $500M in long positions wiped out. Meanwhile, PayPal's move to seek a banking license for its PYUSD stablecoin signals institutional adoption but is offset by ongoing skepticism about Bitcoin ETF performance. Regulatory developments and institutional moves are high-impact, but current sentiment is bearish due to macro risks and technical breakdowns.

headlines: Bitcoin to hit new all-time high within 6 months: Grayscale
US crypto market structure legislation to advance in early 2026
Trump to 'look into' recently convicted Samurai Wallet co-founder
events: US crypto market structure legislation expected to advance in early 2026 (regulatory development)
Grayscale's prediction of Bitcoin reaching a new all-time high within 6 months (institutional sentiment)
articles.summary: Recent news highlights strong bullish sentiment from institutional player Grayscale predicting a new BTC ATH, alongside regulatory progress in the US and political attention on crypto-related figures. These developments suggest increasing legitimacy and momentum in the crypto market, especially for Bitcoin.

headlines: Bitcoin Sinks Towards $85,000 as Ethereum, XRP Fall Alongside
Ripple Expanding RLUSD From Ledger and Ethereum
Bank of America's Analysts Signal Regulatory Shift Towards On-Chain Assets
events: Regulatory shift towards on-chain assets by Bank of America analysts
Ripple expanding RLUSD (a stablecoin) on multiple blockchains
Bitcoin price movement near $85,000 with broader crypto sell-off
articles.summary: Bitcoin and major cryptocurrencies are experiencing a downturn near $85,000, driven by market-wide selling pressure. Ripple is expanding its stablecoin RLUSD across more networks, indicating institutional adoption. Meanwhile, Bank of America analysts suggest a potential regulatory shift favoring on-chain assetsâ€”though this may be seen as delayed or speculative given current price action. The dominant sentiment is bearish due to the sharp decline in BTC and altcoins.
